intro: Payena ornata, commonly known as the African velvet tamarind, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Payena ornata is often found in savanna and woodland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional contexts.
